Html:
hello radioman,

 

sth. changed. :) If you have a focus on a textbox e.g. textboxLng and after that you move your mouse over the MainMap control, you lost the focus of the Textbox. In the past, you didn't lost the focus.

 

      protected override void OnMouseEnter(EventArgs e)
      {
         base.OnMouseEnter(e);
       //  Focus();
      }

Is there a reason for it?

 

bye EDE
to be able zoom in/out using mouse scroll
OK i understand, but i think its better to hit control before zooming is not that bad^^
it's not better at all, it sucks ;}

a solutionexample :)

in Demo

public MainForm()
{
    ....
    this.MouseWheel += new MouseEventHandler(Form_MouseWheel);
    ....
 }

      private void Form_MouseWheel(object sender, MouseEventArgs e)
      {
          this.MainMap.Zoom =this.MainMap.Zoom + (e.Delta / 120);
      }

Zoom still works everywhere, but you do not lost focus on textboxes...^^

Bye EDE
..anyway i can add some property to disable auto focus if you wish?
very useful. needed to turn this off in order to prevent lookupeditors to inadvertently change edit values.
I used Gmap vesion 1.6, but not property DisableFocusOnMouseEnter. I'm so tired of this problem. Looking format to help.

radioman wrote:
map.DisableFocusOnMouseEnter = true;
I used GMap vesion 1.6 but not property DisableFocusOnMouseEnter. I not understand.???
